sources.title: The Phantom In The House (1929)
sources.description: When his wife accidently kills a man while fending off his unwanted advances, an inventor takes the blame and is sent to prison for 15 years. When he gets out, he finds that his daughter doesn't know who he is, and that's just the beginning. An early "talkie".

sources.title: The Phantom In The House (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. In this drama, a man is accused of a murder he didn't commit, and serves fifteen years in prison for it. When he is finally released his wife and daughter are strangers to him. Reviews and box office were not outstanding for this picture, and eventually it was forgotten until it was re-released on DVD.Â

sources.title: The Phantom In The House (1929) PRE-CODE HOLLYWOOD
sources.description:
Stars: Ricardo Cortez, Nancy Welford, Henry B. Walthall
 Director: Phil Rosen

 A man is blamed for a murder that was actually committed by his wife.

metadata.Plot: An inventor takes the blame for a killing his wife committed and serves a long prison sentence. Upon his release he returns, he returns as a 'family friend,' hoping to get to know his now-grown daughter who thinks he is dead. His wife is doing rather well, thank you, from the proceeds of his inventions. but does not seem all that enthused about his return, plus there is an oil-can-harry, gold-digging-gigolo Marquis courting his daughter...and, then, another murder. Will Papa take the fall, this time?
metadata.Actors: Ricardo Cortez, Nancy Welford, Henry B. Walthall
